department.ch: 生醫科學與工程學系系統生物與生物資訊碩士班
department.en: Master Program in Systems Biology and Bioinformatics, Department of Biomedical Sciences and Engineering

goal.ch: 本課程提供生醫理工學院學生必要的分子生物學及基因體學知識從而增強學生對相關領域的了解。
goal.en:
This course is intended for students interested in
understanding fundamental biochemical mechanisms and modern approaches in the areas of molecular
biology and genomics.

outline.ch:
1. Introduction: genes and chromosomes
2. Structure and function of DNA
3. Molecular laboratory techniques
4. Structure of eukaryotic genes/the content of genome
5. Genome sequences /clusters and repeats
6. Protein Targeting and Protein trafficking
7. Cell cycle Regulation
8. DNA replication /DNA repair
9. Midterm exam
10.. mRNA stability, processing, localization, and translation
11. The immune system-I
12. Then immune system-II
13. Cytoskeleton /Extracellular Matrix
14. Cell Signaling Transduction
15. Prokaryotic gene regulation/ Eukaryotic gene regulation I
16. Prokaryotic gene regulation/ Eukaryotic gene regulation II
17. Epigenetic modification
18. Final exam
outline.en:
1. Introduction: genes and chromosomes
2. Structure and function of DNA
3. Molecular laboratory techniques
4. Structure of eukaryotic genes/the content of genome
5. Genome sequences /clusters and repeats
6. Protein Targeting and Protein trafficking
7. Cell cycle Regulation
8. DNA replication /DNA repair
9. Midterm exam
10.. mRNA stability, processing, localization, and translation
11. The immune system-I
12. Then immune system-II
13. Cytoskeleton /Extracellular Matrix
14. Cell Signaling Transduction
15. Prokaryotic gene regulation/ Eukaryotic gene regulation I
16. Prokaryotic gene regulation/ Eukaryotic gene regulation II
17. Epigenetic modification
18. Final exam

textbook.ch: Lewin's GENES XII (9781284104493): Jocelyn E. Krebs,Elliott S. Goldstein, Stephen T. Kilpatrick
textbook.en: Lewin's GENES XII (9781284104493): Jocelyn E. Krebs,Elliott S. Goldstein, Stephen T. Kilpatrick

gradMethod.en:
midterm exam: 30%, final exam: 40%, attendance
rate: 20%, assignments: 10%
